verses.plain: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

tokens.t: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

verses.plain: O LORD, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear! even cry out unto thee of violence, and thou wilt not save!

tokens.t: O
, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear!
cry out unto thee
violence, and thou wilt not save!

verses.plain: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause me to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence are before me: and there are that raise up strife and contention.

tokens.t: Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause
to behold grievance? for spoiling and violence
before me: and there are
raise up strife and contention.

verses.plain: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.

tokens.t: Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth: for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong judgment proceedeth.

verses.plain: ¶ Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for I will work a work in your days, which ye will not believe, though it be told you.

tokens.t: ¶ Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for
will work a work in your days,
ye will not believe, though it be told

verses.plain: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, that bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces that are not theirs.

tokens.t: For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans,
bitter and hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land, to possess the dwellingplaces
not theirs.

verses.plain: They are terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.

tokens.t: They
terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their dignity shall proceed of themselves.

verses.plain: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle that hasteth to eat.

tokens.t: Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle
hasteth to eat.

verses.plain: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up as the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

tokens.t: They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up
the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the sand.

verses.plain: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

tokens.t: And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall heap dust, and take it.

verses.plain: Then shall his mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend, imputing this his power unto his god.

tokens.t: Then shall
mind change, and he shall pass over, and offend,
this his power unto his god.

verses.plain: ¶ Art thou not from everlasting, O LORD my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O LORD, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.

tokens.t: thou not from everlasting, O
my God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O
, thou hast ordained them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for correction.

verses.plain: Thou art of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously, and holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth the man that is more righteous than he?

tokens.t: of purer eyes than to behold evil, and canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal treacherously,
holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth
more righteous than he?

verses.plain: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things, that have no ruler over them?

tokens.t: And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things,
no ruler over them?

verses.plain: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

tokens.t: They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are glad.

verses.plain: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion is fat, and their meat plenteous.

tokens.t: Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense unto their drag; because by them their portion
fat, and their meat plenteous.

verses.plain: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?

tokens.t: Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually to slay the nations?

footnotes.text: their judgment…: or, from them shall proceed the judgment of these, and the captivity of these
their…: or, the supping up of their faces, etc: or, their faces shall look (Heb. the opposition of their faces) toward the east
